Sentencas: The stability of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) cathodes is often severely damaged by impurity poisonings from Cr vapors.
Titulo: Configuration entropy tailored beneficial surface segregation on double perovskite cathode with enhanced Cr-tolerance for SOFC

Sentencas: Here we report a medium entropy GdBa(Mn0.2Fe0.2Co1.2Ni0.2Cu0.2)O5+delta (ME-GBCO) double perovskite cathode, which exhibits remarkably improved Cr-tolerant ability.
Titulo: Configuration entropy tailored beneficial surface segregation on double perovskite cathode with enhanced Cr-tolerance for SOFC

Sentencas: The polarization resistance (Rp) of GBCO increases from -0.44 to -0.70 Omega cm2 after 20 h exposure to Cr in air at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Configuration entropy tailored beneficial surface segregation on double perovskite cathode with enhanced Cr-tolerance for SOFC

Sentencas: In contrast, Rp value of ME-GBCO cathode increases from -0.16 to -0.24
Titulo: Configuration entropy tailored beneficial surface segregation on double perovskite cathode with enhanced Cr-tolerance for SOFC

Sentencas: Omega cm2 under the same condition.
Titulo: Configuration entropy tailored beneficial surface segregation on double perovskite cathode with enhanced Cr-tolerance for SOFC

Sentencas: The enhanced operational stability is attributed to the in situ formed BaCoO3-delta (BCO) nanoparticles on ME-GBCO surface, which is very inactive to Cr vapors.
Titulo: Configuration entropy tailored beneficial surface segregation on double perovskite cathode with enhanced Cr-tolerance for SOFC

Sentencas: This work highlights that the configuration entropy modulation is an effective avenue for surface engineering and for the development of robust cathode materials for SOFCs.
Titulo: Configuration entropy tailored beneficial surface segregation on double perovskite cathode with enhanced Cr-tolerance for SOFC
